ratings.rComments: Nice guy, but doesn't exactly translate into a good professor.

Yes his tests were hard, but they were accompanied by a 10% curve. Other than that, I have no complaints about anything he taught. I found the course to be incredibly easy, just got to lecture and pay attention. I never cracked the book, or studied more than an hour for any of the exams and ended with a 103% in the class. Would recommend.

Exams can be difficult, but definitely doable. Also, he gives a pretty decent curve. Reading the textbook really helps, unless you pay close attention to class. Written portion of exam resembles the homework. The professor is helpful, but expects a bit more from students than the other econ professors at the university.

No interests in rating any prof unless he is really horrible. If you are confident about your intelligence take his class and challenge yourself plz. Exams are really difficult. He is helpful in person but it has nothing to do with your grade  Def avoid him.
Horrible teacher to be honest. Exam does not cover anything learned in class. If you could avoid this teacher, do it.
Exam was so much hard.

Nice guy if you go to his office hours & helpful if you ask him questions. However! Beware that this class has really, really hard test that are based of each previous questions, which means that for example if you get part a wrong, then your entire answer for the other parts will be wrong and you could miss up to 20 points for it!! Hated this test
He is a nice and great professor. I like him. The thing is the exams are quite hard.

Horrible, just reads you the notes in class. Exam questions are like the HW assignments but he never goes over it or teaches you anything that's on the HW. Self taught class, you'll be lucky if you get a C. 12 point curve on a 100 scale though.

The class is difficult, but he's not as terrible as everyone says. I'm currently in the class and doing just fine. Do the homework (there's only 6) and pay attention and you'll at least get a B. Exam questions are extremely similar to the homework and practice exams with no surprises.

Avoid him! About 70% of the class dropped it after he gave us the results from the 1st test! (worth 25%) NO extra credit. I've heard he is the hardest, but who knows.. His tests are extremely difficult!

This professor is crazy! Makes questions worth 12,13, and 23 points in his tests (out of 100)! He divides his questions into different parts, which means that if you get part a wrong, then part b,c,d,e and f will be wrong too! So if you miss one, the highest grade you can get is one lower grade!More than 1/2 the class dropped it after 1st test!!!!!

Lectures are painfully boring, but helpful if you can stay awake. He doesn't care if you go to later sections if you have an early one. Homework is really helpful, make sure you understand it. If you go to class and do your homework, you'll get a decent grade. No surprises.

pretty good professor. lectures are kind of pointless because his slides are straight from the textbook. problems in class are useful but rare. happy to help if you ask questions or go to office hours, but not great at explaining to large groups. good at one-on-one help

Great Professor. Very nice guy and always willing to help. Go to the class, it's maybe a little bit boring but it's helpful for the exam. If you pay attention to this class, you will be fine and you can really learn something. Take ECON302 with he! Great choice!

Go to class and you will be fine. For those who don't understand derivation you should go retake calculus. Can be difficult to understand at times but is very welcoming if you approach him. Good teacher, and recommend taking him over other teachers. Class average tends to be low, which is fine. He makes the class difficult.

Arvin-Rad is a great professor and really cares about getting his students to understand the concepts. He always comes to class with a smile and pushes through dumb business-major type questions. The people who complain about him are the ones who know absolutely no math, or are used to their easy BUS classes. He curves to a B. Great prof. Love him.

This professor should stick to Econ 302. He has no idea how to combine theory of econometrics and applied R (computer software) use. The tests are relatively easy but he gives no help on homework. Good luck trying to find code on random stat forums. HE SUCKS! I hope the University finds a better Econometrics replacement.

Having had the misfortune of taking another ECON 302 class and dropping it mid-way, I can attest that this one is definitely easier. Sure home work assignmets can be hard and the exams will challenge you to think critically. That said there is a great curve in the end and you will learn a lot!

ECON 302 is hard, but Arvin-Rad makes it somewhat easier. Lecture is VERY boring, but EXTREMELY helpful if you can stay awake. The tests are very hard but he puts a HUGE curve on the class so that the average is a B. Go to office hours if you need help w/ homework or just understanding. Arvin-Rad is VERY HELPFUL & somehow has a simile everyday.

Very fair grader, based on class average instead of percentage. Just got an A on the second midterm (1 std. dev. away from the class avg.), which I attribute to forcing myself to lecture despite how boring it is to sit through.

Incredibly nice guy and he always has a smile on his face. I think the difficulty of this class is way overblown... he definitely dumbs it down so the business majors can keep up. He repeats everything 5x so if you don't get it, well...that may be your fault. Grading was very generous, as was the final curve. If you go to class, you'll be fine.

This class is very challenging, but Arvin-Rad is a nice person and tries to be helpful. Lecture is painfully boring, and you aren't required to attend, but if you can force yourself to go and actually pay attention it is helpful. The book is useless and the homework and practice tests and pretty helpful when studying. Tests are very challenging.
Horrible class to sit through. Lectures are extremely boring and hard to follow. Homework/exams do not match what is learned in class.

This class was a refreshing change after two semesters of ECON 102 AND 103 by Gotheil that can perhaps best be described as torture. Save for a few who probably don't think very highly about studying, this class, however, should not really prove challenging and definitely not too boring.
Arvin-Rad clearly has full command of the subject matter, and seems to love what he is doing. The class is easy too- for a 200 level, what we were required to do was basically peanuts. Recommended!

I found him very approachable and genuinely interested in helping students. Overall I enjoyed the class. It is not hard at all provided you put some effort and attend classes. Plus the curve is pretty generous.

no point of going to lecture because you will just fall asleep, and for a guy that usually pays attention in class and doesnt fall asleep in any of his classes, must tell you something. if you go to office hours, all he does is assume you come in to get answers to the homework. if you like naps, take this class, else dont take it with him

This is by far the worst professor on campus. Lectures are pointless and I'd rather invest that time in reading the book. You can barely understand this guy and the class average reflects that (≈60%). I'd highly recommend taking the class with a different professor.

I could barely understand a word he said, class was almost useless to attend, the only reason I did well in the class is because I had a good study group.  Good curve so you don't have to ace it to do well.
I have taken another section (then I dropped).  This one is def easier.  Apparently, he will curve a lot...but i guess i will find out soon enough.  It's still tough material though.

This class isn't the easiest, but Econ 302 with him is easier with him from what I've heard from everyone. Don't buy the books. Lecture slides are all you need. Going to class is definitely helpful, although not necessary. Other people said he was hard to understand, I didn't think so at all. He's a nice guy and is always willing to help.
Nice guy.  All of the HW's and exams are straightforward questions. He curves the class average to a B.  If you study the lecture slides you don't have to go to class

TAKE THIS CLASS!!! I have taken other sections of Econ 302 and all of them have MUCH harder material. The best part about this professor is that his class is not calculus intensive, while other sections of ECON 302 are. The class average was very low, mostly because people never showed up to class. HWs are easy. Class was curved by ALOT

He is really NOT hard to understand. the only thing about his accent is that he says "r's" and "w's" :) He's so adorable, very helpful. exams cover exactly wats on hw. Avg in class is 63% and he makes the avg a B. Truthfully his lectures are boring but he really likes ppl that go and he learns your name. His ppts are all online and very thorough.
Are you kidding me?
a lot of effort to get B+ or A- in this class. I ended up with B+, but a lot of work. It's a hard class for someone that doesnt like econ

DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK.  That is a waste of money.  Other than that Arvin clearly knows his stuff, but he has a thick accent that makes him hard to understand.  He also doesn't write the exams so that is a minus.  He isn't bad, but for ECON 203 I highly recommend getting Petry.
i'm listening to his lecture right now and I can just tell that he's a wonderful teacher.I love you arvin!

The class was pretty dry. Prof. Arvin Rad likes using derivatives, which I had no clue how to use, and still don't. He should have had a session just to go over derivatives. Many people fell asleep in this class, as it can get very boring. I don't think that economics should be boring, but this professor was definitely boring, in my opinion.
Very hard to understand--doesn't really make it easy to go to lecture. He's very nice, willing to help you but can't convey ideas well.

Listen, you can't understand a word this guy says. He has a middle-eastern accent that is so thick it's comical. That said, he is kindly, aloof academic who clearly knows his stuff but can't convey it well. Very willing to help and explain. He doesn't write the tests and the class isn't too hard overall.
A lot of people complain about this guy but he's actually not that bad.  if you go to lecture and take notes, the exams are reasonable.
Haha I love this guy, his English is hilariously impossible to understand. Thus I never went to lecture, but just solved the practice tests religiously and pulled off an easy A in the class.

He knows his stuff. Willing to answer any question given by a student. He follows the book almost perfectly. Attending lectures is helpful but not required. He is great with his students. Has some issues during lectures. He says uhm.. a lot and sometimes struggles get his point across. Quizzes are not that hard and he curves generously. Median=B
he is very cool

I attended almost every one of his lecture with the execption of maybe 3 because I was studying for other midterms instead and even still I found Arvin to be completely useless. He didn't seem to go anywhere with his lectures and was terrible at explaining topics and demonstrating examples. I would never recommend him as a prof.

I found him extremely hard to follow in lecture and personal I didn't feel as though attending his lectures helped. I went to Petry's lectures instead and they were better. If you want to succeed do your own hw and the practice tests as many times as you can stand.

Hassan is a great professor.  If you go to class and actually listen to what he has to say and you pay attention, you will realize that he is a very good teacher and makes things clear.  He is very repetitive and will answer any questions.  Also, if you don't do your own homework, you are screwed. So go to class and do your hw and you will be fine

One of the worst professors I have ever encountered.  Practice tests are no indication of the difficulty or content of the actual exam.  He lets the book do the teaching and then mumbles away an hour and a half of your life twice a week.
No Comments

This guy is seriously the worst public speaker I have ever encountered. He stumbles over his words constantly and speaks to the chalkboard. His class is so boring. I want to just beat my head against the desk the entire time.
